metadata.title: CVE-2014-2281 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The nfs_name_snoop_add_name function in epan/dissectors/packet-nfs.c in theNFS dissector in Wireshark 1.8.x before 1.8.13 and 1.10.x before 1.10.6does not validate a certain length value, which allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) via acrafted NFS packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2281` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark5 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap4 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil4 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-qt - 1.10.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
